title: Adamantine (Chunk)
contents: text | Mined from rocks that fell from the heavens, adamantine is one of the hardest metals known. It has a shiny, black appearance, and it is prized for its amazing resiliency and ability to hold an incredibly sharp edge.

contents: text | Mined from rocks that fell from the heavens, adamantine is one of the hardest metals known. It has a shiny, black appearance, and it is prized for its amazing resiliency and ability to hold an incredibly sharp edge.

contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 1400 gp

text | Adamantine weapons have a shiny black appearance and cut through lesser items with ease. They treat any object they hit as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object's Hardness is greater than that of the adamantine weapon.

text | Adamantine weapons have a shiny black appearance and cut through lesser items with ease. They treat any object they hit as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object's Hardness is greater than that of the adamantine weapon.

title: Adventurer's Pack
contents: text | This item is the starter kit for an adventurer, containing the essential items for exploration and survival. The Bulk value is for the entire pack together, but see the descriptions of individual items as necessary. The pack contains the following items: a backpack, a bedroll, 10 pieces of chalk, flint and steel, 50 feet of rope, 2 weeks' rations, soap, 5 torches, and a waterskin.

title: Clear Spindle Aeon Stone
contents: text | Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.
text | When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body.

text | You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

text | There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different shape, color, and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

text | You don't need to eat or drink while this aeon stone is invested by you. This aeon stone doesn't function until it has been worn continuously for a week and invested each day therein. If it's invested by someone else, this interval starts over.
text | The resonant power allows you to cast air bubble as a primal innate spell once per day.

title: Dull Gray Aeon Stone
contents: text | Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.
text | When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head instead of being worn on your body.

text | You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful Disarm action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

text | There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different shape, color, and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

text | A dull gray aeon stone has lost its special magical properties, sometimes as a result of overusing a tourmaline sphere or pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stone. It still orbits your head like any other aeon stone and can thus serve as a stylish, hands-free option for various spells that target an object, like continual flame.
text | Dull gray aeon stones have no resonant power.

title: Gold Nodule Aeon Stone
contents: text | Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

text | There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different shape, color, and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into a special magical item called a wayfinder.

text | When a gold nodule aeon stone is created, its creator chooses a language they know to store within the crystal. When you invest the stone, you gain the ability to understand, speak, and write that language.
text | The resonant power allows you to cast comprehend language as an occult innate spell once per day.

text | This functions as a pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stone, but it casts an 8th-level dispel magic spell with a counteract modifier of +31.
text | The resonant power allows you to cast detect magic and read aura as arcane innate spells at will.

contents: text | Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. text | An orange prism aeon stone must be activated to provide a benefit. The resonant power grants you a +2 item bonus to Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion checks—whichever corresponds to the tradition of the last spell you enhanced with this aeon stone.
text | **Activate** 1 envision; **Effect** If your next action is to Cast a Spell, that spell's level is 1 higher (maximum 10th level) for the purposes of counteracting and being counteracted.

text | **Activate** R envision; **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** A spell targets you; **Effect** The stone casts a 6th-level dispel magic spell in an attempt to counteract the triggering spell, with a counteract modifier of +22. This can be used only on spells that specifically target you—not area spells that don't have targets. If it succeeds, it counteracts the spell for all targets if other creatures were targeted in addition to you.
text | Each time you activate this aeon stone, attempt a DC 5 flat check. On a failure, the stone permanently turns into a dull gray aeon stone.

contents: text | Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. text | When you invest this stone, you gain 15 temporary Hit Points. If the stone's effects are suppressed, you lose any of the temporary Hit Points remaining until it returns. The temporary Hit Points refresh during your daily preparations; they do not refresh if you re-invest the stone, or invest another pink rhomboid aeon stone, before then.
text | The resonant power allows you to cast the stabilize cantrip as a divine innate spell.

contents: text | Over millennia, these mysterious, intricately cut gemstones have been hoarded by mystics and fanatics hoping to discover their secrets. text | When you would die from the dying condition (typically at dying 4), this aeon stone automatically activates and reduces your dying value to 1 less than would normally kill you (typically to dying 3). The stone then permanently turns into a dull gray aeon stone. You can benefit from this ability only once per day, even if you have multiple such stones.
text | The resonant power allows you to cast 1st-level heal as a divine innate spell once per day.

text | This aeon stone allows you to cast 2nd-level augury as a divine innate spell once per day.

text | Secrets of the Pathfinder Society Whether stored in the vaults of the Grand Lodge, hidden in the minds of various agents, or lost to time from the Society's ancient past, the Pathfinder Society is rife with secrets. Some take the form of unusual magic items; others are spells or special techniques. Agents who discover and use these secrets gain an edge that can help them as they undertake Society missions. All characters affiliated with the Pathfinder Society have access to the uncommon options in this section.
text | The resonant power causes the augury spell from the aeon stone to always succeed at the DC 6 flat check to give an answer other than "nothing."

text | The resonant power grants a separate activation.
text | **Activate** 2 command, Interact; **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** You gain the effect of a chill touch arcane cantrip.

text | The resonant power increases the damage prevented by your aeon stone's shield spell from 5 to 10.

text | The first time each day you die, your vital and spiritual essences mingle together and reside within this aeon stone.

text | You have a limited sense of how many life forces are currently within 30 feet of the stone, which you can potentially use to determine when it's safe to call on the stone's power. At any time within the next hour after your body died, you can spend 1 minute concentrating in order to return to your body.

text | As long as your body is still intact, you are no longer dead— you are restored to 1 HP with the doomed 3 and wounded 3 conditions. You can benefit from the effects of only one pale orange rhomboid aeon stone in a given day.

text | The resonant power allows you to wait more than an hour to return to your body with the aeon stone; as long as the wayfinder remains on the body, your body doesn't decay and you can return at any point.

text | The resonant power allows you to render all of your aeon stones and your wayfinder invisible whenever you use the activation to gain the effects of illusory disguise.

text | This black pearl sparkles with light.

text | **Activate** R envision; **Trigger** you are targeted by a mental effect. **Effect** You receive a +4 status bonus to your saving throw against the triggering effect. Whether or not your save is successful, the aeon stone attempts a counteract check at +30 to immediately reflect a copy of the effect back at the originator, targeting it using the creature's own relevant statistics but controlling the effect as if you had cast it. Every time you activate this aeon stone, attempt a DC 5 flat check. On a failure, the stone shatters and loses its magical properties forever.
text | The resonant power allows you to cast sending once per day.

title: Alarm Snare
contents: pftrait | auditory | consumable | mechanical | snare | trap

text | You create an alarm snare by rigging one or more noisy objects to a trip wire or pressure plate. When you create an alarm snare, you designate a range between 100 to 500 feet at which it can be heard. When a Small or larger creature enters the square, the snare makes a noise loud enough that it can be heard by all creatures in the range you designated.

title: Alchemist Goggles
contents: text | These brass goggles are engraved with flame patterns and have thick, heavy lenses. While worn, they give you a +1 item bonus to Crafting checks to Craft alchemical items and a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with alchemical bombs. You can also ignore lesser cover when making Strikes with alchemical bombs.

title: Alchemist Goggles (Greater)
contents: text | These brass goggles are engraved with flame patterns and have thick, heavy lenses. While worn, they give you a +2 item bonus to Crafting checks to Craft alchemical items and a +2 item bonus to attack rolls with alchemical bombs. You can also ignore lesser cover when making Strikes with alchemical bombs.

title: Alchemist Goggles (Major)
contents: text | These brass goggles are engraved with flame patterns and have thick, heavy lenses. While worn, they give you a +3 item bonus to Crafting checks to Craft alchemical items and a +3 item bonus to attack rolls with alchemical bombs. You can also ignore lesser cover when making Strikes with alchemical bombs.

title: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | fire | splash
text | Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air.
text | The bomb deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

title: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | fire | splash
text | Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air.
text | You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage.

title: Alchemist's Fire (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | fire | splash
text | Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air.
text | You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d8 fire damage, 3 persistent fire damage, and 3 fire splash damage.

title: Alchemist's Fire (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | fire | splash
text | Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air.
text | You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 4d8 fire damage, 4 persistent fire damage, and 4 fire splash damage.

title: Alchemist's Lab
contents: text | You need an alchemist's lab to Craft alchemical items during downtime.

title: Expanded Alchemist's Lab
contents: text | You need an alchemist's lab to Craft alchemical items during downtime.
text | An expanded alchemist's lab gives a +1 item bonus to Crafting checks to create alchemical items.

title: Alchemist's Tools
contents: text | This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks. If you wear your alchemist's tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

title: Aligned Oil
contents: text | This oil fills a weapon with cosmic power of an alignment. Each aligned oil is crafted to one alignment: chaos, evil, good, or law (such as a good-aligned oil). A weapon anointed with this oil gains the effects of the property rune matching its alignment: anarchic (chaos), axiomatic (law), holy (good), or unholy (evil)

title: Anarchic Rune
contents: text | An anarchic rune is jagged and asymmetrical, channeling chaotic energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 chaotic damage against lawful targets. If you are lawful, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

text | When you critically succeed at a Strike with this weapon against a lawful creature, roll 1d6. On a 1 or 2, you deal double minimum damage; on a 3 or 4, double your damage normally; on a 5 or 6, you deal double maximum damage.

title: Animal Staff
contents: text | This staff is topped with carved animal and monster heads.
text | While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify animals.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

title: Animal Staff (Greater)
contents: text | This staff is topped with carved animal and monster heads.
text | While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify animals.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **2nd** animal messenger, speak with animals, summon animal

title: Animal Staff (Major)
contents: text | This staff is topped with carved animal and monster heads.
text | While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify animals.
text | You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.
bullet | **5th** animal form, moon frenzy, summon animal

title: Anklets of Alacrity
contents: text | These gem-studded golden anklets give you a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks. When you invest the anklets, you either increase your Dexterity score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever would give you a higher score.
text | You click the anklets together, gaining a +20-foot status bonus to all your Speeds and the effects of water walk for the next 10 minutes.

title: Antidote (Lesser)
contents: text | An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +2 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.

title: Antidote (Moderate)
contents: text | An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +3 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.

title: Antidote (Greater)
contents: text | An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.

title: Antidote (Major)
contents: text | An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.
text | When you drink the antidote, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one poison of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, the poison is neutralized.

title: Antimagic Rune
contents: text | This intricate rune displaces spell energy, granting you a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] command; **Trigger** A spell targets you or includes you in its area
text | The armor attempts to counteract the triggering spell with the effect of a 7th-level dispel magic spell and a counteract modifier of +26.

title: Antimagic Oil
contents: pftrait | rare | abjuration | consumable | magical | oil
text | This oil contains energy that repels nearly all types of magic.

text | When you apply this oil to armor, the creature wearing the armor becomes immune to all spells, effects of magic items (the wearer's and those of others), and effects with the magical trait for 1 minute. The oil affects neither the magic of the armor nor the fundamental runes of weapons attacking the wearer.
text | Magical effects from a source of 20th level or higher, such as a deity, still function on the armor's wearer.

title: Antiplague (Lesser)
contents: text | Antiplague can fortify the body's defenses against diseases.
text | Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain a +2 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease's progression.

title: Antiplague (Moderate)
contents: text | Antiplague can fortify the body's defenses against diseases.
text | Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain a +3 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease's progression.

title: Antiplague (Greater)
contents: text | Antiplague can fortify the body's defenses against diseases.
text | Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease's progression.

title: Antiplague (Major)
contents: text | Antiplague can fortify the body's defenses against diseases.
text | Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease's progression.
text | When you drink the antiplague, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one disease of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, you are cured of the disease.

title: Armbands of Athleticism
contents: text | Skilled awl work has imprinted images of a muscled weightlifter into these tiered leather bands, which grant you enhanced stamina and skill when performing athletic exercises. While fastened to your upper arms, the armbands give you a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks. In addition, whenever you use an action to Climb or Swim and you succeed at the Athletics check, add a +5-foot item bonus to the distance you move.

title: Armbands of Athleticism (Greater)
contents: text | Skilled awl work has imprinted images of a muscled weightlifter into these tiered leather bands, which grant you enhanced stamina and skill when performing athletic exercises. While fastened to your upper arms, the armbands give you a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks. In addition, whenever you use an action to Climb or Swim and you succeed at the Athletics check, add a +5-foot item bonus to the distance you move.
text | The bonus to Athletics checks is +3, and the bonus to a successful check to Climb or Swim is +10 feet.

title: Armor Potency (+1) Rune
contents: text | Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.

text | You can upgrade the armor potency rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

title: Armor Potency (+2) Rune
contents: text | Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 2, and the armor can be etched with two property runes.

text | You can upgrade the armor potency rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

title: Armor Potency (+3) Rune
contents: text | Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 3, and the armor can be etched with three property runes.

text | You can upgrade the armor potency rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

title: Arrow
contents: text | These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

title: Arrow-catching Shield
contents: text | This remarkable wooden shield (Hardness 10, HP 60, BT 30) is carved with images of overlapping fletched arrows.

section | **Activate** [[reaction]] Interact; **Trigger** A ranged weapon Strike targets a creature within 15 feet of you when you have this shield raised, and the attacker has not yet rolled their attack
text | The triggering Strike targets you instead of its normal target.
text | If it hits, you gain the effects of the Shield Block reaction.

title: Arsenic
contents: text | This toxin is a compound of arsenic and other substances. You can't reduce your sickened condition while affected.
section | Affliction DC 18 Fortitude; **Onset** 10 minutes; **Max Dur.** 5 minutes
bullet | Stage 1 | 1d4 poison damage and sickened 1 (1 minute)
bullet | Stage 2 | 1d6 poison damage and sickened 2 (1 minute)
bullet | Stage 3 | 2d6 poison damage and sickened 3 (1 minute)

title: Artisan's Tools
contents: text | You need these tools to create items from raw materials with the Craft skill. Different sets are needed for different work, as determined by the GM; for example, blacksmith's tools differ from woodworker's tools. If you wear your artisan's tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

title: Sterling Artisan's Tools
contents: text | You need these tools to create items from raw materials with the Craft skill. Different sets are needed for different work, as determined by the GM; for example, blacksmith's tools differ from woodworker's tools. If you wear your artisan's tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.
text | Sterling artisan's tools give you a +1 item bonus to the check.

title: Axiomatic Rune
contents: text | Complex and symmetrical, an axiomatic rune imbues a weapon with lawful energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 lawful damage against chaotic targets. If you are chaotic, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

text | When you critically succeed at an attack roll with this weapon against a chaotic creature, instead of rolling, count each weapon damage die as average damage rounded up (3 for d4, 4 for d6, 5 for d8, 6 for d10, 7 for d12).

title: Backpack
contents: text | A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items. and the first 2 Bulk of these items don't count against your Bulk limits. If you're carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it on your back, its Bulk is light instead of negligible.

title: Bag of Holding (Type I)
contents: text | Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The bag's extradimensional space can hold 25 Bulk.

text | You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

text | If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

title: Bag of Holding (Type II)
contents: text | Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The bag's extradimensional space can hold 50 Bulk.

text | You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

text | If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

title: Bag of Holding (Type III)
contents: text | Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The bag's extradimensional space can hold 100 Bulk.

text | You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

text | If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

title: Bag of Holding (Type IV)
contents: text | Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The bag's extradimensional space can hold 150 Bulk.

text | You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

text | If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

title: Barding of the Zephyr
contents: text | This light barding is covered in stylized wind motifs. When you suit up your animal companion, the barding adjusts to fit your animal companion regardless of its shape.
text | When your companion falls, wind picks it up from below; it gains the effects of feather fall.

text | You trace a finger along the wind motifs on the barding, granting your companion wearing the barding a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes. Even if the companion doesn't have the mount special ability, it can still Fly while being ridden.

title: Barkskin Potion
contents: text | After you drink this bitter draft, your skin thickens like bark. You gain the effects of a 2nd-level barkskin spell for 10 minutes.

title: Basic Crafter's Book
contents: property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 sp
text | This book contains the formulas for Crafting the common items in Chapter 6: Equipment of the Core Rulebook.

title: Beacon Shot
contents: text | The shaft of a beacon shot is studded with tiny flecks of glimmering gemstones. When an activated beacon shot hits a target, it embeds itself into that target and spews sparks for 1 minute. If the target is invisible, it becomes merely hidden to creatures who would otherwise be unable to see it. The sparks also negate the concealed condition if the target was otherwise concealed.
text | A creature can remove the arrow or bolt by using an Interact basic action and succeeding at a DC 20 Athletics check.

title: Belladonna
contents: text | Sometimes called "deadly nightshade," belladonna is a widely available toxin produced from a plant similar to a tomato.
section | Affliction DC 19 Fortitude; **Onset** 10 minutes; **Max Dur.** 30 minutes
bullet | Stage 2 | 1d6 poison damage and sickened 1 (10 minutes)
bullet | Stage 3 | 1d6 poison damage, confused, and sickened 1 (1 minute)

title: Belt of Giant Strength
contents: text | This thick leather belt is decorated with a buckle carved from glittering quartz in the shape of a fist. You gain a +3 item bonus to Athletics checks and a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to lift a heavy object, Escape, and Force Open. When you invest the belt, you either increase your Strength score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever would give you a higher score.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] Interact; **Trigger** You are targeted by a thrown rock attack, or a rock would fall on you

text | Attempt an Athletics check to grab the triggering rock. Use the Athletics DC of the creature throwing the rock, the DC of the hazard or other effect, or DC 35 if no other DC is applicable. You must have a free hand to catch the rock, but you can Release anything you're holding in a hand as part of this reaction.
property | Success | You safely catch the rock, take no damage, and are now holding the rock.
property | Failure | You take half damage.
property | Critical Failure | You take full damage.

title: Belt of Regeneration
contents: text | This belt is crafted from rubbery troll hide that's green and orange in color. You gain 15 temporary Hit Points the first time you invest the belt in a day. When you invest the belt, you either increase your Constitution score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever would give you a higher score.

text | You tighten the belt one notch to gain a regeneration effect. For 2d4 rounds, at the start of your turn each round, you recover 15 Hit Points unless you took acid or fire damage since the start of your previous turn.

title: Belt of the Five Kings
contents: text | Made from interlocking plates of silver and gold, this heavy belt bears stylized miniature images of five kingly dwarves. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression with dwarves or make a Request from dwarves. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Intimidation checks against giants and orcs.
text | The belt also grants you darkvision and the ability to understand, speak, and write the Dwarven language.
text | You tighten the belt one notch to gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level and grant allies within 20 feet of you darkvision. Both effects last for 10 minutes.

title: Berserker's Cloak
contents: text | This bearskin includes the head and bared teeth of the mighty creature from which it was taken. When worn, the cloak drapes over your head and around your shoulders, imbuing you with a bear's ferocity. If you have the Rage action, while raging you grow jaws that deal 1d10 piercing damage and claws that deal 1d6 slashing damage and have the agile trait.

text | This transformation is a morph effect, and both the jaws and claws are unarmed attacks in the brawling weapon group. You gain the benefits of a +1 weapon potency rune and a striking rune with these attacks (gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by one).

text | If you have an animal instinct and the bestial rage instinct ability, instead of gaining these unarmed attacks, your unarmed attacks from the bestial rage instinct ability gain the benefits of a +2 weapon potency rune and a greater striking rune (granting a +2 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by two).

title: Berserker's Cloak (Greater)
contents: text | This bearskin includes the head and bared teeth of the mighty creature from which it was taken. When worn, the cloak drapes over your head and around your shoulders, imbuing you with a bear's ferocity. If you have the Rage action, while raging you grow jaws that deal 1d10 piercing damage and claws that deal 1d6 slashing damage and have the agile trait.

text | This transformation is a morph effect, and both the jaws and claws are unarmed attacks in the brawling weapon group. You gain the benefits of a +2 weapon potency rune and a greater striking rune with these attacks (gaining a +2 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by two).

text | If you have an animal instinct and the bestial rage instinct ability, instead of gaining these unarmed attacks, your unarmed attacks from the bestial rage instinct ability gain the benefits of a +3 weapon potency rune and a major striking rune (granting a +3 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by three).

title: Bestial Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals 1d4 slashing damage and has the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage. The duration is 1 minute.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

title: Bestial Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d8 piercing damage. The duration is 10 minutes.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

title: Bestial Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals 1d8 slashing damage and has the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d10 piercing damage. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

title: Bestial Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals 1d8 slashing damage and has the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d10 piercing damage. You also gain weapon specialization with the claws and jaws, or greater weapon specialization, if you already have weapon specialization with these unarmed attacks. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

title: Biting Snare
contents: text | The snare's jaws shut on the leg of a creature that steps on it. The snare deals 5d6 piercing damage to the first creature that enters its square; that creature must attempt a DC 18 Reflex save.
property | Critical Success | The creature is unaffected.
property | Success | The creature takes half damage.
property | Failure | The creature takes full damage.
property | Critical Failure | The creature takes double damage and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed until it recovers at least 1 Hit Point.

title: Black Adder Venom
contents: text | Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.
section | Affliction DC 18 Fortitude; **Onset** immediate; **Max Dur.** 3 rounds

title: Black Lotus Extract
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | contact | poison | virulent
text | Black lotus extract causes severe internal bleeding.
section | Affliction DC 42 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 minute; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds
bullet | Stage 1 | 15d6 poison damage and drained 1 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 2 | 17d6 poison damage and drained 1 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 3 | 20d6 poison damage and drained 2 (1 round)

title: Bleeding Spines Snare
contents: text | When a creature enters the square, spines covered in numerous jagged thorns protrude out to stab it, dealing 8d8 piercing damage and 2d8 persistent bleed damage. The creature must attempt a DC 31 basic Reflex saving throw. After the initial trigger, the spines retract and protrude again repeatedly for 1 minute, forcing any creature that enters the space or ends its turn in the space to attempt a Reflex save against the spines' damage.

title: Blightburn Resin
contents: text | This tacky, hardened sap is harvested from trees infected by fungal blights and exposed to open flames.
section | Affliction DC 31 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 minute; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds

title: Bloodletting Kukri
contents: text | This +1 striking kukri has a crimson blade that shimmers eerily in bright light. On a critical hit, the kukri deals 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If the target didn't already have persistent bleed damage when you scored the critical hit, you also gain 1d8 temporary Hit Points.

title: Bloodseeker Beak
contents: text | This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood. When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

title: Blowgun Dart
contents: text | These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.

title: Bolt
contents: text | Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

title: Bomb Snare
contents: text | You create a snare that catalyzes three 3rd-level moderate alchemical bombs of the same type to explode when a creature enters the snare's square. The target and all creatures in adjacent squares must attempt a DC 26 Reflex save, as the snare deals damage equal to three times the direct hit damage from one of the component bombs (for example, 6d6 electricity damage from bottled lightning) with no splash damage or other effects.
property | Critical Success | The creature is unaffected.
property | Success | The creature takes half damage and no other effects.

property | Failure | The creature takes full damage. It also takes all other effects of a direct hit from one of the component bombs (such as {@condition flat-footed} from bottled lightning or {@condition persistent damage} from an acid flask).
property | Critical Failure | The creature takes double damage, plus all other effects of a direct hit (as failure).

title: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 1.

title: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 2.

title: Boots of Bounding
contents: text | The springy soles of these sturdy leather boots cushion your feet and make each step lighter. These boots give you a +5-foot item bonus to your Speed and a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to High Jump and Long Jump. In addition, when you use the Leap action, you can move 5 feet further if jumping horizontally or 3 feet higher if jumping vertically.

title: Boots of Bounding (Greater)
contents: text | The springy soles of these sturdy leather boots cushion your feet and make each step lighter. These boots give you a +5-foot item bonus to your Speed and a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to High Jump and Long Jump. In addition, when you use the Leap action, you can move 5 feet further if jumping horizontally or 3 feet higher if jumping vertically.
text | The bonus to Speed is +10 feet, and the bonus to High Jump and Long Jump is +3.

title: Boots of Elvenkind
contents: text | These tall, pointed boots are made from soft, supple black or green leather and are decorated with trim and buckles of gold. When worn, the boots allow you to move more nimbly, granting you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

text | Until the end of your turn, you ignore difficult terrain when moving on the ground. If you're wearing a cloak of elvenkind, you also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your land Speed until the end of your turn.

title: Boots of Elvenkind (Greater)
contents: text | These tall, pointed boots are made from soft, supple black or green leather and are decorated with trim and buckles of gold. When worn, the boots allow you to move more nimbly, granting you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

text | Until the end of your turn, you ignore difficult terrain when moving on the ground. If you're wearing a cloak of elvenkind, you also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your land Speed until the end of your turn.
text | The boots grant a +2 bonus. If you're also wearing a cloak of elvenkind, greater boots of elvenkind constantly grant the effects of pass without trace (DC 30) in forest environments.

title: Boots of Speed
contents: text | These sleek red boots make your legs feel like they're bursting with energy. You gain a +5-foot item bonus to your land Speed and to any climb or swim Speeds you have.

text | You click the heels of the boots together and gain the quickened condition for 1 minute. You can use the extra action to Stride, Climb, or Swim. (You must still attempt an Athletics check for the Climb and Swim actions unless you have the appropriate movement type.)

title: Bottled Air
contents: text | Appearing to be an ordinary corked glass bottle, this item contains a limitless supply of fresh air. You must uncork the bottle with an Interact action before you can activate it.

text | You draw a breath of air from the bottle. This allows you to breathe even in an airless or toxic environment. Air doesn't escape the mouth of the bottle, so leaving the open bottle in an airless environment doesn't change the environment.

title: Bottled Lightning (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | electricity | splash

text | Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. The bomb deals 1d6 electricity damage and 1 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

title: Bottled Lightning (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | electricity | splash

text | Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. The bomb deals 2d6 electricity damage and 2 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

title: Bottled Lightning (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | electricity | splash

text | Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. The bomb deals 3d6 electricity damage and 3 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

title: Bottled Lightning (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | bomb | consumable | electricity | splash

text | Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. The bomb deals 4d6 electricity damage and 4 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

title: Bracelet of Dashing
contents: text | This jangling, silvery bracelet makes you lighter on your feet, giving you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.
text | You gain a +10-foot status bonus to Speed for 1 minute.

title: Bracers of Armor (Type I)
contents: text | These stiff leather armguards grant you a +1 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

title: Bracers of Armor (Type II)
contents: text | These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

title: Bracers of Armor (Type III)
contents: text | These stiff leather armguards grant you a +3 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

title: Bracers of Missile Deflection
contents: text | These bracers are made from plates of durable mithral and gleam like the summer sun.
text | The bracers send the missile off-course. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this would cause the attack to be a failure, the attack misses you.

title: Bracers of Missile Deflection (Greater)
contents: text | These bracers are made from plates of durable mithral and gleam like the summer sun.
text | The bracers send the missile off-course. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this would cause the attack to be a failure, the attack misses you.

title: Bravo's Brew (Lesser)
contents: text | This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves, or +2 when attempting Will saves against fear.

title: Bravo's Brew (Moderate)
contents: text | This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves, or +3 when attempting Will saves against fear.

title: Bravo's Brew (Greater)
contents: text | This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +3 item bonus to Will saves, or +4 when attempting Will saves against fear. If you roll a success on a save against fear, you get a critical success instead.

title: Breastplate of Command
contents: text | This +1 resilient breastplate is made from shining bronze overlaid with reinforcing golden panels in the shape of lion's heads. Wearing this breastplate grants you a commanding aura. You gain a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks, but you take a –2 item penalty to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak and Deception checks to Impersonate.

text | You grant allies within 100 feet a +2 status bonus to saves against fear effects for 1 minute. When you activate this ability, each affected ally who's frightened reduces their frightened value by 1.

title: Breastplate of Command (Greater)
contents: text | This +1 resilient breastplate is made from shining bronze overlaid with reinforcing golden panels in the shape of lion's heads. Wearing this breastplate grants you a commanding aura. You gain a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks, but you take a –2 item penalty to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak and Deception checks to Impersonate.

text | You grant allies within 100 feet a +2 status bonus to saves against fear effects for 1 minute. When you activate this ability, each affected ally who's frightened reduces their frightened value by 1.
text | The armor is a +2 greater resilient breastplate. The item bonus and penalty increase to +3 and –3, respectively.

title: Brimstone Fumes
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | evil | inhaled | poison
text | Fumes from the forges of Hell drain health and strength alike.
section | Affliction DC 36 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 round; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds
bullet | Stage 1 | 7d6 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 2 | 8d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 3 | 10d6 poison damage and enfeebled 3 (1 round)

title: Bronze Bull Pendant
contents: text | This pendant is forged from grainy steel and depicts a snorting bull's face. The pendant must be attached to the chest area or on a shoulder guard. When you activate the pendant, you gain a +2 status bonus to the Athletics check to Shove, and if you roll a critical failure on the check, you get a failure instead.

title: Brooch of Shielding
contents: text | This piece of silver or gold jewelry is adorned with miniature images of kite shields and can be used to fasten a cloak or cape. The brooch automatically absorbs magic missile spells targeting you. A brooch of shielding can absorb 30 individual magic missiles before it melts and becomes useless.
text | Sometimes when found, a brooch of shielding has already absorbed a number of missiles.

title: Broom of Flying
contents: text | This broom has a tenuous connection to gravity, and it tends to drift even while stowed. You can ride on the broom using one hand to guide it, and the broom can carry up to one passenger in addition to you. The broom moves at a fly Speed of 20 feet.
text | The broom can carry only so much, taking a –10-foot penalty to its Speed if laden with more than 20 Bulk, and crashing to the ground if it carries more than 30 Bulk.

text | You name a destination on the same plane, and the broom speeds toward it at a fly Speed of 40 feet. You must either clutch the broom with two hands in order to ride it, or you need to release the broom to send it off with no rider. If you don't have a good idea of the location, layout, and general direction of the destination, or if your named destination is on another plane, the broom wanders aimlessly, circling back to its starting location after 30 minutes.
text | If the broom carries a rider, this activation lasts until 4 hours pass (typically 16 miles of travel), the broom reaches its destination, or you Dismiss the activation.

text | If the broom doesn't have a rider, the activation lasts until the broom reaches its destination. When the activation ends, the broom floats to the ground and can't be activated again for 1 hour.

title: Caltrop Snare
contents: text | This snare consists of a hidden canister of caltrops attached to a trip wire. When the snare is triggered, it flings the caltrops into either the snare's square or a square adjacent to the snare. You choose which square when you set up the snare.
text | If the caltrops scatter into the same square as a creature, that creature must attempt the Acrobatics check immediately.

title: Caltrops
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 3 cp

text | These four-pronged metal spikes can damage a creature's feet. You can scatter caltrops in an empty square adjacent to you with an Interact action. The first creature that moves into that square must succeed at a DC 14 Acrobatics check or take 1d4 piercing damage and 1 persistent bleed damage. A creature taking persistent bleed damage from caltrops takes a –5-foot penalty to its Speed. Spending an Interact action to pluck the caltrops free reduces the DC to stop the bleeding. Once a creature takes damage from caltrops, enough are ruined that other creatures moving into the square are safe. Deployed caltrops can be salvaged and reused if no creatures took damage from them. Otherwise, enough are ruined that they can't be salvaged.

title: Candle (10)
contents: text | A lit candle sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius for 8 hours.

title: Candle of Truth
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | enchantment | magical | mental
text | This tapered candle has a golden wick that burns with white fire.
text | You activate the candle by lighting it, which causes creatures within 10 feet of the candle to find it difficult to tell falsehoods.
text | Creatures in the area receive a –4 status penalty to Lie.

text | In addition, when first entering the affected area, each creature (including you) must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be unable to tell any deliberate lies while within 10 feet of the lit candle. This lasts for as long as the candle is lit. Once lit, the candle burns for 10 minutes, and it cannot be extinguished.

title: Cape of the Mountebank
contents: text | This bright red-and-gold cape is often interlaced with glittery threads and serves as a distraction. While wearing the cape, you gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks.

text | You cast dimension door. The space you leave and the one you appear in are filled with puffs of smoke that make anyone within concealed until they leave the smoke or the end of your next turn, at which point the smoke dissipates.
text | Strong winds immediately disperse the smoke.

title: Cassock of Devotion
contents: text | Each cassock of devotion depicts scenes related to the domains of a certain deity. It serves as a religious symbol of that deity, and it doesn't need to be wielded to provide that benefit. You gain a +2 item bonus to Religion checks and a +1 item bonus to the divine skill of the deity to whom the cassock is dedicated (as listed on pages 437–440).

text | You gain 1 Focus Point, which you can spend only to cast a cleric domain spell for a domain belonging to the deity the cassock is dedicated to. If you don't spend this Focus Point by the end of this turn, it is lost.

title: Cat's Eye Elixir
contents: text | After you consume this elixir, your vision sharpens and you become sensitive to even the most minute movements. For the next minute, you reduce the flat check to target hidden creatures to 5, and you don't need to attempt a flat check to target concealed creatures. These benefits apply only against creatures within 30 feet of you.

title: Caterwaul Sling
contents: text | Made of shiny brown leather, this +1 striking sling has a single white thread interwoven into its cord.
text | You pull the white thread free, then whirl the sling in circles at high speed. It lets out an ear-piercing wave of sound.
text | Each creature in a 30-foot cone takes 4d6 sonic damage (DC 21 basic Fortitude save). Any creature that fails is deafened for 1 round, or 1 hour on a critical failure.

title: Celestial Armor
contents: text | This suit of +2 resilient chain mail is made of fine white links of a strange and slightly translucent pale metal, and the sleeves and skirt are fashioned into smaller trails that resemble feathers. Unlike normal chain mail, celestial armor has no Speed reduction, its armor check penalty is 0, and its Bulk is 1.

text | You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws against fiends. You appear radiant while you wear the armor, giving you a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks against all creatures except fiends.
text | If you are not good, you are drained 2 while wearing celestial armor. You can't recover from this condition while wearing the armor.

text | The armor sprouts glowing wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet. The wings shed bright light in a 40-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet). The wings fade away after 10 minutes.

title: Channel Protection Amulet
contents: text | This nugget of polished tektite is trapped in a cage of braided wire and hangs from a silken cord. When wearing this amulet, you gain resistance 5 against damage from harm spells if you're living, or against heal spells if you're undead.

title: Cheetah's Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a +5 status bonus to your Speed for 1 minute.

title: Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)
contents: text | Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a +10 status bonus to your Speed for 10 minutes.

title: Cheetah's Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a +10 status bonus to your Speed for 1 hour.

title: Chest
contents: text | A wooden chest can hold up to 8 Bulk of items.

title: Chime of Opening
contents: text | This hollow mithral tube is about a foot long and bears engravings reminiscent of open locks and broken chains.
text | The chime can be activated 10 times before it cracks and becomes useless.

text | You aim the chime at a container, door, or lock you want to open and strike the chime. The chime sends out magical vibrations that attempt a Thievery check against the lock's DC, with a Thievery bonus of +13. This targets only one lock or binding at a time, so you might need to activate the chime multiple times to open a target with several forms of protection.

title: Choker of Elocution
contents: text | This platinum choker bears characters from a language's alphabet, and it gives knowledge of that language and the associated culture's customs. You gain a +1 item bonus to Society checks and the ability to understand, speak, and write the chosen language.
text | Your excellent elocution reduces the DC of the flat check to perform an auditory action while deafened from 5 to 3.

title: Choker of Elocution (Greater)
contents: text | This platinum choker bears characters from a language's alphabet, and it gives knowledge of that language and the associated culture's customs. You gain a +1 item bonus to Society checks and the ability to understand, speak, and write the chosen language.
text | Your excellent elocution reduces the DC of the flat check to perform an auditory action while deafened from 5 to 3.
text | The item bonus is +2. The choker bears characters from three languages and grants fluency in all three.

title: Circlet of Persuasion
contents: text | This elegant silver band often resembles curling fig leaves and fits around your brow. You gain a +2 item bonus to Deception and Diplomacy checks.
text | When you invest the circlet, you either increase your Charisma score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever would give you a higher score.
text | You cast a 4th-level charm spell (DC 38).

title: Clandestine Cloak
contents: text | When you pull up the hood of this nondescript gray cloak (an Interact action), you become drab and uninteresting, gaining a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks and to Deception checks to Impersonate a forgettable background character, such as a servant, but also taking a –1 item penalty to Diplomacy and Intimidation checks.
text | You pull the cloak's hood up and gain the benefits of nondetection for 1 hour or until you pull the hood back down, whichever comes first.

title: Clandestine Cloak (Greater)
contents: text | When you pull up the hood of this nondescript gray cloak (an Interact action), you become drab and uninteresting, gaining a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks and to Deception checks to Impersonate a forgettable background character, such as a servant, but also taking a –1 item penalty to Diplomacy and Intimidation checks.
text | You pull the cloak's hood up and gain the benefits of nondetection for 1 hour or until you pull the hood back down, whichever comes first.
text | The item bonus is +2, and when you activate the cloak, you gain the benefits of 5th-level nondetection for 8 hours.

title: Climbing Bolt
contents: text | The shaft of this bolt is wrapped with fine twine. When the bolt strikes a solid surface, the twine unwinds and enlarges into a 50-foot-long rope, securely fastened to the surface the bolt struck. The rope can be pulled free with an Interact action and a successful DC 20 Athletics check.

title: Climbing Kit
contents: text | This satchel includes 50 feet of rope, pulleys, a dozen pitons, a hammer, a grappling hook, and one set of crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a DC 5 flat check whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit. If you wear your climbing kit, you can access it as part of a Climb action.

title: Extreme Climbing Kit
contents: text | This satchel includes 50 feet of rope, pulleys, a dozen pitons, a hammer, a grappling hook, and one set of crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a DC 5 flat check whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit. If you wear your climbing kit, you can access it as part of a Climb action.
text | You gain a +1 item bonus to Athletics checks to Climb while using an extreme climbing kit.

title: Cloak of Elvenkind
contents: text | This cloak is deep green with a voluminous hood, embroidered with gold trim and symbols significant in elven culture. The cloak allows you to cast the ghost sound cantrip as an arcane innate spell. When you adjust the cloak's clasp (an Interact action), the cloak transforms to match the environment around you and muffles your sounds, granting you a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks.

text | You draw the hood up and gain the effects of invisibility, with the spell's normal duration or until you pull the hood back down, whichever comes first. If you're also wearing boots of elvenkind, you can activate this ability twice per day.

title: Cloak of Elvenkind (Greater)
contents: text | This cloak is deep green with a voluminous hood, embroidered with gold trim and symbols significant in elven culture. The cloak allows you to cast the ghost sound cantrip as an arcane innate spell. When you adjust the cloak's clasp (an Interact action), the cloak transforms to match the environment around you and muffles your sounds, granting you a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks.

text | You draw the hood up and gain the effects of invisibility, with the spell's normal duration or until you pull the hood back down, whichever comes first. If you're also wearing boots of elvenkind, you can activate this ability twice per day.

text | The cloak grants a +2 item bonus, and the effects of 4th-level invisibility. If you're also wearing boots of elvenkind, the greater cloak of elvenkind allows you to Sneak in forest environments even when creatures are currently observing you.

title: Cloak of the Bat
contents: text | Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

text | You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-level pest form spell on you.

title: Cloak of the Bat (Greater)
contents: text | Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

text | You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-level pest form spell on you.
text | The item bonus is +3, and you can activate the cloak any number of times per day.

title: Clothing (Ordinary)
contents: text | Ordinary clothing is functional with basic tailoring, such as peasant garb, monk's robes, or work clothes.

title: Clothing (Fine)
contents: text | Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns. You can wear only one tool set of light Bulk with fine clothing, instead of the normal limit of 2 Bulk.

title: Clothing (High-Fashion Fine)
contents: text | You gain a +1 item bonus to checks to Make an Impression on upper-class folk while wearing high-fashion fine clothing.

title: Clothing (Winter)
contents: text | Winter clothing allows you to negate the damage from severe environmental cold and reduce the damage from extreme cold to that of severe cold.

title: Cognitive Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge for 1 minute. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

title: Cognitive Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge for 10 minutes. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

title: Cognitive Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge for 1 hour. You become trained in one Intelligence-based skill, chosen at creation. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

title: Cognitive Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge for 1 hour. You become trained in one skill, chosen at creation. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

title: Cold Iron (Chunk)
contents: text | Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike.
text | Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.

title: Cold Iron (Ingot)
contents: text | Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike.
text | Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.

title: Cold Iron (Low-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike.
text | Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.

title: Cold Iron (Standard-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike.
text | Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.

title: Cold Iron (High-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike.
text | Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.

title: Cold Iron Armor (Low-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 140 gp

text | Cold iron armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is sickened 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.

title: Cold Iron Armor (Standard-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 1200 gp

text | Cold iron armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is sickened 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.

title: Cold Iron Armor (High-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 20000 gp

text | Cold iron armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is sickened 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.

title: Low-Grade Cold Iron Buckler
contents: text | Cold iron shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.
text | Craft Bulk L; Requirements cold iron worth at least 15 sp The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.

title: Cold Iron Shield (Low-Grade)
contents: text | Cold iron shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.
text | Craft Bulk 1; Requirements cold iron worth at least 17 sp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

title: Standard-Grade Cold Iron Buckler
contents: text | Cold iron shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.

title: Cold Iron Shield (Standard-Grade)
contents: text | Cold iron shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.

title: High-Grade Cold Iron Buckler
contents: text | Cold iron shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.

title: Cold Iron Shield (High-Grade)
contents: text | Cold iron shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.

title: Cold Iron Weapon (Low-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 40 gp
text | Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

title: Cold Iron Weapon (Standard-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 880 gp
text | Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

title: Cold Iron Weapon (High-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 9000 gp
text | Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

title: Collar of Empathy
contents: text | This ornate collar of intertwined leather strips of contrasting colors is paired with a bracelet of a similar construction.

text | When you wear and invest the bracelet and your companion wears and invests the collar, you gain a stronger connection to each other. You and your companion can always sense each others' emotional states and basic physical wants and needs.

text | You perceive through your animal companion's senses instead of your own. You can Sustain the Activation. You are unaware of your own surroundings for as long as you are using your animal companion's senses.

text | In addition to the obvious use when you are separated from your companion, this ability might allow you to notice sounds, scents, and other stimuli that your companion's senses register but yours alone don't.

title: Collar of Inconspicuousness
contents: text | This leather collar's worn and almost threadbare look belies its magical nature. When your companion wears and invests the collar, it gains the ability to change its appearance from that of a ferocious animal into a more inconspicuous form.

text | You touch your animal companion to transform it into a nonthreatening Tiny creature of the same family or a similar creature (for instance, a house cat instead of a tiger, or a puppy instead of a wolf). This has the effects of pest form (2nd level, or 4th level if your companion can fly). The effect lasts until you Dismiss it.

title: Compass
contents: text | A compass helps you Sense Direction or navigate, provided you're in a location with uniform magnetic fields. Without a compass, you take a –2 item penalty to these checks (similar to using a shoddy item).

title: Lensatic Compass
contents: text | A compass helps you Sense Direction or navigate, provided you're in a location with uniform magnetic fields. Without a compass, you take a –2 item penalty to these checks (similar to using a shoddy item).
text | A lensatic compass gives you a +1 item bonus to these checks.

title: Comprehension Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For 1 minute after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn't automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages—you still need to attempt a skill check to Decipher Writing.

title: Comprehension Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For 10 minutes after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn't automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages—you still need to attempt a skill check to Decipher Writing.

title: Corrosive Rune
contents: text | Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt.
text | In addition, on a critical hit, the target's armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.

title: Corrosive (Greater) Rune
contents: text | Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt.
text | In addition, on a critical hit, the target's armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.
text | The acid damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's acid resistance. Increase the acid damage dealt to armor or a shield on a critical hit to 6d6.

title: Coyote Cloak
contents: text | This dusty coat is made of mangy brown-and-gray coyote fur.
text | You gain a +1 item bonus to Survival checks. If you critically succeed at your Survival check to Subsist, you can feed twice as many additional creatures.

title: Coyote Cloak (Greater)
contents: text | This dusty coat is made of mangy brown-and-gray coyote fur.
text | You gain a +1 item bonus to Survival checks. If you critically succeed at your Survival check to Subsist, you can feed twice as many additional creatures.
text | The cloak grants a +2 item bonus, and if you critically succeed at a Survival check to Subsist, you can feed four times as many additional creatures.

title: Crafter's Eyepiece
contents: text | This rugged metal eyepiece etched with square patterns is designed to be worn over a single eye. Twisting the lens reveals a faint three-dimensional outline of an item you plan to build or repair, with helpful labels on the component parts. While worn, this eyepiece gives you a +1 item bonus to Crafting checks. When you Repair an item, increase the Hit Points restored by 15 per proficiency rank instead of 10.

title: Crafter's Eyepiece (Greater)
