title: Necklace of Fireballs (Type VII)
contents: text | This string of beads appears to be a hemp string with lustrous red beads of various sizes hanging from it. When activated, it briefly appears in its true form: a golden chain with golden spheres attached by fine threads.
text | This necklace has one 18d6, three 16d6 and five 14d6 beads with a DC 39 basic Reflex save. When all the beads are gone, the necklace becomes a non-magical hemp string.

text | You detach a sphere from the necklace, causing it to glow with orange light. After you activate a sphere, if you or anyone else hurls it (an Interact action with the ranged trait), it detonates as a fireball where it lands. Your toss can place the center of the fireball anywhere within 70 feet, though at the GM's discretion you might need to make an attack roll if the throw is unusually challenging. If no one hurls the sphere by the start of your next turn, it turns into a non-magical red bead.

title: Nectar of Purification
contents: text | A shimmering liquid, nectar of purification is often stored in bottles similar to those used for vinegar. This oil casts a 1st-level purify food and drink spell over any food or drink onto which it's poured. The nectar evaporates as it takes effect, leaving the taste and texture of the food or drink unaltered.

title: Nettleweed Residue
contents: text | Concentrated sap of stinging weeds makes an effective toxin.
section | Affliction DC 27 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 minute; **Max Dur.** 6 minutes

title: Nightmare Vapor
contents: text | Purportedly sourced from any number of outlandish locales, nightmare vapor is most often created by boiling the sweat collected from humanoids caught in the throes of terrible nightmares.
section | Affliction DC 36 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 round; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds
bullet | Stage 2 | confused and flat-footed (1 round)
bullet | Stage 3 | confused, flatfooted, and stupefied 2 (1 round)

title: Oathbow
contents: text | Constructed of a flexible, white wood and with ornate, twisting designs carved into its surface, this +2 striking composite longbow appears to have been made by elves. Sometimes when you loose an arrow, its whistling in flight sounds like a voice whispering in Elven, wishing for the swift defeat of your enemies.

text | You swear an oath to destroy one creature you can see. For the next 7 days or until that creature is slain, your attacks with the bow against that creature deal 1d6 additional damage, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to Track that creature. Your critical hits against the target gain the bow's critical specialization effect (page 283); if they would already do so, they instead increase the DC of the Athletics check to Escape when critically hit to DC 20.

text | After you activate the bow, you can't activate it again for 7 days. If you kill the creature you've sworn an oath against, the oath ends and you need to wait only 10 minutes before you can activate it again.

title: Obfuscation Oil
contents: text | You can spread this blue-gray gel on a single item with a Bulk of 3 or less to ward it against magical detection. It becomes immune to divination magic of 8th level or lower (such as locate). This oil is permanent, but it can be removed with acid.
text | Removing the oil in this way usually takes 1 minute for objects with Bulk of 1 or less, or a number of minutes equal to the item's Bulk.

title: Oil (1 pint)
contents: text | You can use oil to fuel lanterns, but you can also set a pint of oil aflame and throw it. You must first spend an Interact action preparing the oil, then throw it with another action as a ranged attack. If you hit, it splatters on the creature or in a single 5-foot square you target. You must succeed at a DC 10 flat check for the oil to ignite successfully when it hits. If the oil ignites, the target takes 1d6 fire damage.

title: Oil of Animation
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | magical | oil | transmutation

text | You can rub this bronze-colored oil onto a melee weapon to grant it the benefits of the dancing rune (page 583). Once you fail a flat check for the weapon, causing it to fall, this effect ends.

title: Oil of Keen Edges
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | magical | oil | transmutation

text | When this silvery salve is applied to a melee weapon that deals piercing or slashing damage, the weapon grows sharper and more dangerous for 1 minute, granting it the benefits of the keen rune.

title: Oil of Mending
contents: text | A vial of oil of mending appears to have countless translucent threads swirling within. Applying this oil to an item casts a 2nd-level mending spell to repair the item.

title: Oil of Potency
contents: text | When you apply this thick, viscous oil to a weapon or suit of armor, that item immediately becomes magically potent. If the item is a weapon, it temporarily becomes a +1 striking weapon, or, if it's armor, it temporarily becomes +1 resilient armor. This lasts for 1 minute.

title: Oil of Repulsion
contents: text | This oil contains magnetically charged iron filings repelled into opposite ends of the vial. For 1 minute after you apply this oil to armor, any creature that hits you with a melee Strike must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save with the following effects.
property | Success | The creature is unaffected.
property | Failure | The creature is pushed up to 10 feet away from you (the GM determines the direction).
property | Critical Failure | As failure, and the creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

title: Oil of Weightlessness
contents: text | You can spread this shimmering oil on an item of 1 Bulk or less to make it feel weightless. It has negligible Bulk for 1 hour.

title: Oil of Weightlessness (Greater)
contents: text | You can spread this shimmering oil on an item of 2 Bulk or less to make it feel weightless. It has negligible Bulk for 8 hours.

title: Omnidirectional Spear Snare
contents: text | As soon as a creature enters the snare's square, the snare unleashes wickedly powerful spears at the creature from all directions, dealing 19d8 piercing damage (DC 37 basic Reflex).

title: Onyx Panther
contents: text | This small stone is a stylized panther shape. When you activate it, you can move your full Speed (instead of half) during the triggering Sneak and any other time you Sneak this turn.

title: Orichalcum (Chunk)
contents: text | The most rare and valuable skymetal, orichalcum is coveted for its incredible time-related magical properties. This dull, coppery metal isn't as physically sturdy as adamantine, but orichalcum's time-bending properties protect it, granting it greater Hardness and Hit Points. If an orichalcum item takes damage but isn't destroyed, it repairs itself completely 24 hours later.

title: Orichalcum (Ingot)
contents: text | The most rare and valuable skymetal, orichalcum is coveted for its incredible time-related magical properties. This dull, coppery metal isn't as physically sturdy as adamantine, but orichalcum's time-bending properties protect it, granting it greater Hardness and Hit Points. If an orichalcum item takes damage but isn't destroyed, it repairs itself completely 24 hours later.

title: Orichalcum (High-Grade  Object)
contents: text | The most rare and valuable skymetal, orichalcum is coveted for its incredible time-related magical properties. This dull, coppery metal isn't as physically sturdy as adamantine, but orichalcum's time-bending properties protect it, granting it greater Hardness and Hit Points. If an orichalcum item takes damage but isn't destroyed, it repairs itself completely 24 hours later.

title: Orichalcum Armor (High-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 55000 gp

text | Orichalcum armor can be etched with four magic property runes instead of three due to the magical empowerment of orichalcum. If you are wearing armor made of orichalcum, the armor grants you insights into the future, granting you a +1 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.

title: High-Grade Orichalcum Buckler
contents: text | Orichalcum shields' time-bending properties are particularly useful for keeping them intact. The first time each day an orichalcum shield would be destroyed, it is instead left with 1 Hit Point and the broken condition.

title: Orichalcum Shield (High-Grade)
contents: text | Orichalcum shields' time-bending properties are particularly useful for keeping them intact. The first time each day an orichalcum shield would be destroyed, it is instead left with 1 Hit Point and the broken condition.
text | gp; Bulk 1; Craft Requirements orichalcum worth at least6,600 gp The shield has Hardness 16, HP 64, and BT 32.

title: Orichalcum Weapon (High-Grade)
contents: text | Orichalcum weapons can have four magic property runes instead of three.

text | Due to orichalcum's temporal properties, etching the speed weapon property rune onto an orichalcum weapon costs half the normal Price (though transferring the rune to a weapon made of another material requires you to first pay the remaining Price and then pay the cost to transfer).

title: Owlbear Claw
contents: text | This claw set in an iron clasp and chain isn't always the claw of an owlbear. When you activate the claw, the triggering attack gains the weapon's critical specialization effect.

title: Panacea
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | healing | magical | necromancy | potion

text | This potion appears to shift colors, and no two observers describe it in the same way. When consumed, it attempts to counteract all curses and diseases affecting you, as well as the blinded and deafened conditions from spells affecting you.
text | The potion has a counteract level of 7 and a +20 modifier for the roll.

title: Pendant of the Occult
contents: text | This amulet is hollow and shaped in the form of an unblinking eye. Its cavity typically holds some fragment of occult text. While wearing the pendant, you gain a +1 item bonus to Occultism checks, and you can cast the guidance cantrip as an occult innate spell.

title: Pendant of the Occult (Greater)
contents: text | This amulet is hollow and shaped in the form of an unblinking eye. Its cavity typically holds some fragment of occult text. While wearing the pendant, you gain a +1 item bonus to Occultism checks, and you can cast the guidance cantrip as an occult innate spell.
text | The pendant grants a +2 item bonus and can be activated.
text | **Activate** 10 minutes (Cast a Spell); **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** You cast a 4th-level dream message spell.

title: Penetrating Ammunition
contents: text | This ammunition has a slender shape and a viciously pointed tip. When you activate and shoot penetrating ammunition, the Strike takes the shape of a 60-foot line originating from you.

text | Roll one attack roll and compare the result to the AC of each target in the line. The ammunition ignores up to 10 of a target's resistance, and it can penetrate walls up to 1 foot thick with Hardness 10 or less. Each target that takes damage from this ammunition also takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage.

text | If your attack roll result is a natural 20, you improve your degree of success only against the first target in the line, but you can still score a critical hit on other targets if your result exceeds their AC by 10 or more. If you have access to your bow's critical specialization effect, penetrating ammunition applies that effect only against a target in the last square of the line.

title: Persona Mask
contents: text | Despite covering the entire face, this alabaster mask does not hinder vision or other senses. Wearing the mask grants a +1 item bonus to Performance checks while acting, orating, performing comedy, or singing.
text | You change the mask's appearance into an artistic rendition of a dramatic character of your choice.

title: Persona Mask (Greater)
contents: text | Despite covering the entire face, this alabaster mask does not hinder vision or other senses. Wearing the mask grants a +1 item bonus to Performance checks while acting, orating, performing comedy, or singing.
text | You change the mask's appearance into an artistic rendition of a dramatic character of your choice.
text | The mask grants a +2 bonus and can be activated.

text | **Activate** R envision (fortune); **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You fail a Performance check that benefits from the mask's bonus; **Effect** You change the mask's character and reroll the Performance check, using the second result.

title: Philosopher's Stone
contents: text | An alchemist with the Craft Philosopher's Stone feat can create a philosopher's stone once per month by spending 1 batch of infused reagents during their daily preparations using the advanced alchemy class feature. This is the only way to create a philosopher's stone.

text | At a glance, a philosopher's stone appears to be an ordinary, sooty piece of natural rock. Breaking the rock open with a Force Open action (DC 35) reveals a cavity at the stone's heart. The cavity is lined with a rare type of quicksilver that can transmute base metals into precious metals or create an elixir of rejuvenation (page 548)
text | To use the quicksilver, you must be legendary in Crafting and have the Alchemical Crafting feat. You can then use the stone's quicksilver for one of two effects:

bullet | You can apply the stone's quicksilver to an infused true elixir of life using an Interact action. This turns the elixir into an infused elixir of rejuvenation instantaneously. This doesn't require any crafting time or additional materials.

bullet | You can spend up to a month of downtime applying the quicksilver either to iron to create silver or to lead to create gold. Treat this as a 20th-level task to Earn Income using Crafting, except that you create 500 gp worth of your chosen metal per day on a success or 750 gp worth per day on a critical success.

title: Phylactery of Faithfulness
contents: text | This tiny box holds a fragment of religious scripture sacred to a particular deity. The box is worn by affixing it to a leather cord and tying it around your head just above your brow. You don't gain any benefit from the phylactery if you don't worship the affiliated deity. The phylactery grants you religious wisdom, which manifests as a +2 item bonus to Religion checks. Just before you perform an action that would be anathema to the phylactery's deity, the phylactery warns you of the potential transgression in time for you to change your mind.
text | You ask for guidance about a particular course of action, gaining the effects of an augury spell.

title: Phylactery of Faithfulness (Greater)
contents: text | This tiny box holds a fragment of religious scripture sacred to a particular deity. The box is worn by affixing it to a leather cord and tying it around your head just above your brow. You don't gain any benefit from the phylactery if you don't worship the affiliated deity. The phylactery grants you religious wisdom, which manifests as a +2 item bonus to Religion checks. Just before you perform an action that would be anathema to the phylactery's deity, the phylactery warns you of the potential transgression in time for you to change your mind.
text | You ask for guidance about a particular course of action, gaining the effects of an augury spell.
text | The phylactery grants a +3 item bonus, and you can activate it once every 30 minutes.

title: Piton
contents: text | These small spikes can be used as anchors to make climbing easier. To affix a piton, you must hold it in one hand and use a hammer to drive it in with your other hand. You can attach a rope to the hammered piton so that you don't fall all the way to the ground on a critical failure while Climbing.

title: Plate Armor of the Deep
contents: text | This suit of +2 greater resilient full plate is decorated with swirling, ornate motifs of waves and fish scales. While wearing it, you take no Speed reduction or check penalty from armor when Swimming, gain a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to Swim, can breathe underwater, and can speak Aquan.

title: Pocket Stage
contents: property | Bulk | L (when not activated) | Price | 138 gp
text | This item appears to be a miniature replica of a theater.
text | It includes a small pocket full of minute set dressing and costumed paper dolls.

text | You place the miniature theater on the ground, filling it with any set dressing and up to six figures you choose. Then, you tap a rhythm on the miniature, causing it to grow into a modest stage 20 feet wide and 15 feet deep. It's dressed with the decorations you selected, and simple mannequins wear the costumes you chose. A wooden proscenium arch frames the stage, and simple curtains along the sides conceal the wings.
text | As a magical structure, the stage has the structure trait.

text | All the stage's set dressing is illusory and disappears if taken more than 20 feet from the stage. The costumes are physical but with illusory embellishments that fade at the same range, revealing only plain, white smocks.

title: Possibility Tome
contents: text | An array of semiprecious stones is set into the ornate silver and beaten copper cover of this thick and weighty tome. If you open the book before it's been activated, its vellum pages are blank and pristine, but once activated, words dance and swim onto the pages before your eyes.

text | As you flip through the book, you think about a broad topic you want to know more about. Choose one skill: Arcana, Crafting, Medicine, Nature, Occultism, Religion, Society, or a single subcategory of Lore. The book's pages fill with information about that skill, though only you can see the information. While the pages are full, you can spend an Interact action perusing the book just before attempting a check to Recall Knowledge with the chosen skill. This grants you a +3 item bonus to the check, and if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.
text | The information within the book disappears after 24 hours or when the tome is activated again.

title: Potency Crystal
contents: text | This fluorite crystal glows with a strange phosphorescence.

text | When you activate the crystal, the weapon becomes a +1 striking weapon for the rest of the turn, gaining a +1 item bonus to the attack roll and increasing the damage on a hit to two weapon damage dice.

title: Potion of Flying (Standard)
contents: text | Upon drinking this effervescent concoction, you gain a fly Speed of 40 feet for 1 minute.

title: Potion of Flying (Greater)
contents: text | Upon drinking this effervescent concoction, you gain a fly Speed of 40 feet for 1 hour.

title: Potion of Leaping
contents: text | For 1 minute after you drink this fizzy potion, whenever you Leap, you gain the effect of the 1st-level jump spell.

title: Potion of Quickness
contents: text | Drinking this silver potion grants you the effects of haste for 1 minute.

title: Potion of Resistance (Lesser)
contents: text | Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants resistance 5 against a single damage type for 1 hour. Each potion of resistance is created to defend against acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (and is called a lesser potion of fire resistance or the like).

title: Potion of Resistance (Moderate)
contents: text | Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants resistance 10 against a single damage type for 1 hour. Each potion of resistance is created to defend against acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (and is called a lesser potion of fire resistance or the like).

title: Potion of Resistance (Greater)
contents: text | Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants resistance 15 against a single damage type for 1 hour. Each potion of resistance is created to defend against acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (and is called a lesser potion of fire resistance or the like).

title: Potion of Swimming (Moderate)
contents: text | This potion tastes like salt water, and sandy grit settles to the bottom of its container. When you drink it, you gain a swim Speed equal to your land Speed for 10 minutes.

title: Potion of Swimming (Greater)
contents: text | This potion tastes like salt water, and sandy grit settles to the bottom of its container. When you drink it, you gain a swim Speed equal to your land Speed for 1 hour.

title: Potion of Tongues
contents: pftrait | uncommon | consumable | divination | magical | potion

text | This sour potion enlivens your tongue with unusual flavors and uncommon eloquence, allowing you to speak and understand all languages for 4 hours after you drink it. This doesn't allow you to read these languages in their written form.

title: Potion of Undetectability
contents: text | Drinking this dull-black liquid makes you undetectable to divinations. This grants the same effects as mind blank, but without the bonus against mental effects. You also gain the effects of a 4th-level invisibility spell, which protects against see invisibility spells of 8th level and lower and has a DC of 36 against true seeing. The potion's effects last for 10 minutes.

title: Potion of Water Breathing
contents: text | This filmy, gray potion smells of an old fish midden and tastes even worse. After drinking this potion, you gain the effects of a 2nd-level water breathing spell for 1 hour.

title: Primeval Mistletoe (Standard)
contents: text | This sprig of berry-festooned holly and mistletoe doesn't wilt or rot. It can be used as a primal focus, and it also grants the creature holding it a +1 item bonus to Nature checks.
text | You squeeze juice from one of the berries and smear it onto a club or staff to cast shillelagh upon it.
text | You can twine the sprig around the wrist of one hand and touch a tree to cast tree shape upon yourself, except instead of a becoming a tree, you become a vine on the touched tree.

title: Primeval Mistletoe (Greater)
contents: text | This sprig of berry-festooned holly and mistletoe doesn't wilt or rot. It can be used as a primal focus, and it also grants the creature holding it a +1 item bonus to Nature checks.
text | You squeeze juice from one of the berries and smear it onto a club or staff to cast shillelagh upon it.
text | You can twine the sprig around the wrist of one hand and touch a tree to cast tree shape upon yourself, except instead of a becoming a tree, you become a vine on the touched tree.

text | The sprig grants a +2 bonus and can be activated in one additional way: **Activate** 2 Interact; **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** You plant the primeval mistletoe into an area of natural earth or stone. Once planted, the plant immediately sprouts into an area of holly bushes that don't impede movement and that pulse with positive energy, replicating the effects of a field of life spell. This lasts for up to 1 minute, as long as you continue to Sustain the Activation. When this magic ends, the holly bushes revert back into the original primeval mistletoe.

title: Purple Worm Venom
contents: text | Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.
section | Affliction DC 32 Fortitude; **Onset** immediate; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds
bullet | Stage 1 | 5d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 2 | 6d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 3 | 8d6 poison and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

title: Quicksilver Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based attack rolls, and you gain a +5 foot bonus to your Speed. The duration is 1 minute.
text | **Drawback** You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

title: Quicksilver Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based attack rolls, and you gain a +10 foot bonus to your Speed. The duration is 10 minutes.
text | **Drawback** You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

title: Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based attack rolls, and you gain a +15 foot bonus to your Speed. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

title: Quicksilver Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and Dexterity-based attack rolls, and you gain a +20 foot bonus to your Speed. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

title: Rations (1 week)
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 4 sp

title: Reflecting Shield
contents: text | This high-grade silver buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) is polished to a mirrorlike sheen. The shield functions as a spellguard shield (see below) that can also reflect spells.
text | You attempt to reflect the spell on its caster, with the effects of a 9th-level spell turning with a counteract modifier of +30.

title: Religious Symbol (Wooden)
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 sp

text | This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

title: Religious Symbol (Silver)
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 2 gp

text | This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

title: Religious Text
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 gp

text | This manuscript contains scripture of a particular religion. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious text as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious text must be held in one hand to use it.

title: Repair Kit
contents: text | A repair kit allows you to perform simple repairs while traveling. It contains a portable anvil, tongs, woodworking tools, a whetstone, and oils for conditioning leather and wood. You can use a repair kit to Repair items using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn repair kit as part of the action that uses it.

title: Repair Kit (Superb)
contents: text | A repair kit allows you to perform simple repairs while traveling. It contains a portable anvil, tongs, woodworking tools, a whetstone, and oils for conditioning leather and wood. You can use a repair kit to Repair items using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn repair kit as part of the action that uses it.
text | A superb repair kit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check.

title: Replacement Cosmetics
contents: text | If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

title: Elite Replacement Cosmetics
contents: text | If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

title: Replacement Picks
contents: text | If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with replacement picks appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

title: Replacement Picks (Infiltrator)
contents: text | If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with replacement picks appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

title: Replacement Picks (Concealable)
contents: text | If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with replacement picks appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

title: Resilient Rune
contents: text | Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic.
text | This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

text | You can upgrade the resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

title: Resilient (Greater) Rune
contents: text | Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic.
text | This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

text | You can upgrade the resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
text | The armor grants a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

title: Resilient (Major) Rune
contents: text | Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic.
text | This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

text | You can upgrade the resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
text | The armor grants a +3 item bonus to saving throws.

title: Retribution Axe
contents: text | The blade of this +1 greataxe bears a design of a human skull. Whenever a creature damages you with an attack, the skull changes its appearance to look like the face of that creature. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your next damage roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
text | Because the face reshapes each time you're damaged, you get the additional damage only if you attack the creature that damaged you most recently.

title: Returning Rune
contents: text | When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

title: Rhino Hide
contents: text | This +1 resilient hide armor is made from rhinoceros hide. It has an armor check penalty of –1 instead of –3. When you use the Sudden Charge class feat while wearing this armor, your Strike deals an additional 1d8 damage.

title: Ring of Climbing
contents: text | Claw-like prongs on his thick golden band bears extend to dig deep into sheer surfaces when you are Climbing. This ring grants you a climb Speed equal to half your land Speed.
text | Penalties to your Speed (including those from your armor) apply before halving.

title: Ring of Counterspells
contents: text | This ornate silver ring bears two competing geometric designs of brightly colored and wildly clashing inlaid gemstones. A spellcaster can cast a single spell into this ring as long as no spell is currently stored within, expending the normal time, costs, and so forth to Cast the Spell. The spell's effect doesn't occur; the spell's power is instead stored within the ring.

text | When you invest a ring of counterspells, you immediately know the name and level of the spell stored inside, if any. A ring of counterspells found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell stored in it. The GM determines that spell.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] envision; **Trigger** You are targeted by or within the area of the spell stored within the ring
text | You can attempt to counteract the triggering spell, using the level of the spell stored in the ring and a counteract modifier of +19.
text | Once you do, the stored spell's energy is spent, and the ring is empty.
text | You harmlessly expend the stored spell, having no effect but emptying the ring so that another spell can be cast into it.

title: Ring of Energy Resistance
contents: text | This ring grants you resistance 5 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.

title: Ring of Energy Resistance (Greater)
contents: text | This ring grants you resistance 5 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.

title: Ring of Energy Resistance (Major)
contents: text | This ring grants you resistance 5 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.

title: Ring of Lies
contents: text | This plain silver ring has an almost oily sheen. While wearing the ring, you gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks.
text | Snapping your fingers on the hand that wears the ring causes the ring to cast glibness on you with no visual manifestations of a spell being cast.

title: Ring of Maniacal Devices
contents: text | This ring seems like simple tarnished brass, but it enhances your curiosity about traps and devices of all kinds. You can use an Interact action to pull a set of thieves' tools from the ring. These tools appear in your hand and fold back into the ring if they would leave your possession. They grant you a +2 item bonus to Thievery checks to Disable a Device and to Pick a Lock, and the ring's insights grant you the same bonus to Crafting checks to Craft and Repair snares and traps.

text | You create a 4th-level glyph of warding containing fireball. You can have only one glyph of warding from a ring of maniacal devices active at a time, even if you have multiple rings, and the spell ends if you lose your investiture in the ring.

title: Ring of Maniacal Devices (Greater)
contents: text | This ring seems like simple tarnished brass, but it enhances your curiosity about traps and devices of all kinds. You can use an Interact action to pull a set of thieves' tools from the ring. These tools appear in your hand and fold back into the ring if they would leave your possession. They grant you a +2 item bonus to Thievery checks to Disable a Device and to Pick a Lock, and the ring's insights grant you the same bonus to Crafting checks to Craft and Repair snares and traps.

text | You create a 4th-level glyph of warding containing fireball. You can have only one glyph of warding from a ring of maniacal devices active at a time, even if you have multiple rings, and the spell ends if you lose your investiture in the ring.
text | The ring grants a +3 bonus. Activating it creates an 8th-level glyph of warding containing your choice of either prismatic spray or 7th-level fireball.

title: Ring of Spell Turning
contents: text | This golden ring has three diamonds set into its face.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] envision; **Trigger** You are targeted by a spell

text | The ring replicates the effects of an 8th-level spell turning with a counteract modifier of +35, possibly causing the triggering spell to reflect back on its caster. The ring can reflect no more than 9 total levels of spells per day. If you activate the ring to reflect a spell that would exceed this limit, the attempt fails, but the attempted usage of the ring does not count toward the daily limit.

title: Ring of Sustenance
contents: text | This polished wooden ring constantly refreshes your body and mind. You don't need to eat or drink while wearing it, and you need only 2 hours of sleep per day to gain the benefits of 8 hours of sleep. A ring of sustenance doesn't function until it's been worn and invested continuously for a week. Removing it resets this interval.

title: Ring of Swimming
contents: text | This blue metal ring grants you a swim Speed equal to half your land Speed. Penalties to your Speed (including from your armor) apply before halving.

title: Ring of the Ram
contents: text | This heavy iron ring is shaped to look like the head of a ram, with curling horns.

text | A ram-shaped blast of force slams into one foe that you can see within 60 feet. The number of actions you spend to **Activate** this Item (from 1 to 3) determines the intensity of the force. The blow deals 2d6 force damage per action spent and pushes the target 5 feet per action spent. The target must attempt a DC 22 Fortitude save.
property | Critical Success | The target is unaffected.
property | Success | The target takes half damage and is pushed half the distance.
property | Failure | The target takes full damage and is pushed the full distance.
property | Critical Failure | The target takes double damage and is pushed twice the distance.

title: Ring of the Ram (Greater)
contents: text | This heavy iron ring is shaped to look like the head of a ram, with curling horns.

text | A ram-shaped blast of force slams into one foe that you can see within 60 feet. The number of actions you spend to **Activate** this Item (from 1 to 3) determines the intensity of the force. The blow deals 2d6 force damage per action spent and pushes the target 5 feet per action spent. The target must attempt a DC 22 Fortitude save.
property | Critical Success | The target is unaffected.
property | Success | The target takes half damage and is pushed half the distance.
property | Failure | The target takes full damage and is pushed the full distance.
property | Critical Failure | The target takes double damage and is pushed twice the distance.

text | The ring deals 3d6 force damage per action spent, and the save DC is 32. When you activate the ring using 3 actions, you can disperse the force into multiple magical rams, targeting all creatures in a 30-foot cone instead of one target within 60 feet.

title: Ring of Wizardry (Type I)
contents: text | This ring is made from the purest platinum and is covered in esoteric arcane symbols. It does nothing unless you have a spellcasting class feature with the arcane tradition. While wearing the ring of wizardry, you gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana checks and have two additional 1st-level arcane spell slots each day. You prepare spells in these slots or cast from them spontaneously, just as you normally cast your spells.

text | If you take off the ring for any reason, you lose the additional spell slots. You can't gain spell slots from more than one ring of wizardry per day, nor can a single ring of wizardry grant spell slots more than once per day.

text | If you can cast arcane spells in a variety of different ways (such as if you are a draconic bloodline sorcerer with the wizard multiclass archetype), you can divide the spell slots as you wish among your various sources of arcane spells.

title: Ring of Wizardry (Type II)
contents: text | This ring is made from the purest platinum and is covered in esoteric arcane symbols. It does nothing unless you have a spellcasting class feature with the arcane tradition. While wearing the ring of wizardry, you gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana checks and have two additional 1st-level arcane spell slots each day. You prepare spells in these slots or cast from them spontaneously, just as you normally cast your spells.

text | If you take off the ring for any reason, you lose the additional spell slots. You can't gain spell slots from more than one ring of wizardry per day, nor can a single ring of wizardry grant spell slots more than once per day.

text | If you can cast arcane spells in a variety of different ways (such as if you are a draconic bloodline sorcerer with the wizard multiclass archetype), you can divide the spell slots as you wish among your various sources of arcane spells.

title: Ring of Wizardry (Type III)
contents: text | This ring is made from the purest platinum and is covered in esoteric arcane symbols. It does nothing unless you have a spellcasting class feature with the arcane tradition. While wearing the ring of wizardry, you gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana checks and have two additional 1st-level arcane spell slots each day. You prepare spells in these slots or cast from them spontaneously, just as you normally cast your spells.

text | If you take off the ring for any reason, you lose the additional spell slots. You can't gain spell slots from more than one ring of wizardry per day, nor can a single ring of wizardry grant spell slots more than once per day.

text | If you can cast arcane spells in a variety of different ways (such as if you are a draconic bloodline sorcerer with the wizard multiclass archetype), you can divide the spell slots as you wish among your various sources of arcane spells.

title: Ring of Wizardry (Type IV)
contents: text | This ring is made from the purest platinum and is covered in esoteric arcane symbols. It does nothing unless you have a spellcasting class feature with the arcane tradition. While wearing the ring of wizardry, you gain a +1 item bonus to Arcana checks and have two additional 1st-level arcane spell slots each day. You prepare spells in these slots or cast from them spontaneously, just as you normally cast your spells.

text | If you take off the ring for any reason, you lose the additional spell slots. You can't gain spell slots from more than one ring of wizardry per day, nor can a single ring of wizardry grant spell slots more than once per day.

text | If you can cast arcane spells in a variety of different ways (such as if you are a draconic bloodline sorcerer with the wizard multiclass archetype), you can divide the spell slots as you wish among your various sources of arcane spells.

title: Robe of Eyes
contents: text | This garment appears to be an ordinary robe until donned, at which point numerous strange and alien eyes of varied shapes and colors open and blink across its fabric. While wearing the robe, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, and you constantly benefit from the effects of a 2nd-level see invisibility spell.

text | You can also see powerful magic auras. The highest-level magic aura within 30 feet of you glows in a color that reveals its school to you and allows you to determine where the effect originates. This can narrow down the origin point of the effect to a 5-foot-cube, but not more precisely than that.

text | The robe of eyes is not without its dangers. If any spell with the light trait is cast on you or your square while you are wearing the robe, you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's level unless you succeed at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.
text | You pluck an eye from the robe and toss it into the air, where it turns invisible and floats to a destination you choose, with the same effect as a 5th-level prying eye spell.
text | You can Sustain the Activation just as you would be able to Sustain the Spell.

title: Robe of the Archmagi
contents: text | Embroidered with fine silver thread in ornate arcane patterns, these robes come in one of three colors depending on their attuned alignment. Good robes are gold, neutral robes are light blue, and evil robes are red. An evil or good robe gains the appropriate trait. The robes benefit only characters who can cast arcane spells and whose alignment on the good-evil axis matches that of the robe. If your alignment does not match that of the robe, or you are not an arcane spellcaster, you are instead stupefied 2 while wearing a robe of the archmagi. This condition can't be removed in any way until you remove the robe.
text | The robes are greater resilient, and they grant a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against arcane spells and resistance 5 to damage from arcane spells.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] command; **Trigger** You attempt a saving throw against an arcane spell, but you haven't rolled yet
text | You automatically succeed at your save against the triggering arcane spell.

title: Robe of the Archmagi (Greater)
contents: text | Embroidered with fine silver thread in ornate arcane patterns, these robes come in one of three colors depending on their attuned alignment. Good robes are gold, neutral robes are light blue, and evil robes are red. An evil or good robe gains the appropriate trait. The robes benefit only characters who can cast arcane spells and whose alignment on the good-evil axis matches that of the robe. If your alignment does not match that of the robe, or you are not an arcane spellcaster, you are instead stupefied 2 while wearing a robe of the archmagi. This condition can't be removed in any way until you remove the robe.
text | The robes are greater resilient, and they grant a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against arcane spells and resistance 5 to damage from arcane spells.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] command; **Trigger** You attempt a saving throw against an arcane spell, but you haven't rolled yet
text | You automatically succeed at your save against the triggering arcane spell.
text | The resistance against arcane spells is 10.

text | You can activate the robe when you or an ally within 30 feet attempts a saving throw against an arcane spell, and the robe grants either you or the ally a success on the triggering saving throw; you still can activate it only once per day.

title: Rod of Negation
contents: text | This long, plain, leaden rod can disrupt magic.

text | This rod emits a thin, gray beam that negates a spell or magic item, casting a 6th-level dispel magic spell with a counteract modifier of +23. Once activated, the rod can't be activated again for 2d6 hours.

title: Rod of Wonder
contents: text | This peculiar rod is strange and unpredictable. Each time it is activated, it produces one of a variety of effects at random.

text | Choose a creature within 60 feet and roll d% on the table below to determine the rod's effect. If an entry lists only a spell name, the rod casts that spell at its lowest level. You make any decisions for a spell cast by the rod unless otherwise indicated, except that it must target the creature you chose, or the creature you chose must be the center of the spell's area, if it has an area but no targets. If the spell's range is less than 60 feet, increase the range to 60 feet.
text | Any spell DC required is DC 27, and any spell attack roll required is +17. If the rod casts a spell on you, you don't get a saving throw or other defense against it.
text | Once activated, the rod can't be activated again for 1d4 hours.

title: Rope (50 feet)
contents: property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | L | Price | 5 sp

title: Runestone
contents: text | This flat piece of hard stone is specially prepared for etching a magical fundamental rune or property rune. You can etch only one rune upon a stone. Once the stone is etched, it gains the magic school trait of the rune etched upon it. When a rune is transferred from the runestone to another object, the runestone cracks and is destroyed. The Price listed is for an empty stone; a stone holding a rune adds the Price of the rune.

title: Sack (5)
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 cp

text | A sack can hold up to 8 Bulk worth of items. A sack containing 2 Bulk or less can be worn on the body, usually tucked into a belt. You can carry a sack with one hand, but must use two hands to transfer items in and out.

title: Saddlebags
contents: property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | L | Price | 2 sp

text | Saddlebags come in a pair. Each can hold up to 3 Bulk of items, and the first 1 Bulk of items in each doesn't count against your mount's Bulk limit. The Bulk value given is for saddlebags worn by a mount. If you are carrying or stowing saddlebags, they count as 1 Bulk instead of light Bulk.

title: Salamander Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat.

title: Salamander Elixir (Moderate)
contents: text | This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat.
text | You're also protected from extreme heat.

title: Salamander Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat.
text | You're also protected from extreme and incredible heat.

title: Salve of Antiparalysis
contents: pftrait | consumable | healing | magical | necromancy | oil
text | Applying this filmy salve to a creature helps it overcome magical paralysis. The creature recovers as if it were the target of a 3rd-level remove paralysis spell.

title: Salve of Antiparalysis (Greater)
contents: pftrait | consumable | healing | magical | necromancy | oil
text | Applying this filmy salve to a creature helps it overcome magical paralysis.
text | A greater salve of antiparalysis can potentially remove petrification. The creature recovers as if it were the target of both a 6th-level remove paralysis spell and a stone to flesh spell.

title: Salve of Slipperiness
contents: text | This greenish, persistent grease can be applied to armor to make it extremely slippery for 8 hours, granting the wearer a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape or to Squeeze.

title: Savior Spike
contents: pftrait | abjuration | consumable | force | magical | talisman

text | This pyramid-shaped spike is attached to an armor's chest piece. When you activate the spike, it shoots a strand of force to help you gain purchase. If you roll a success on the triggering attempt, you get a critical success instead (if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead).

title: Scholarly Journal
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 6 gp

text | Scholarly journals are uncommon. Each scholarly journal is a folio on a very specific topic, such as vampires or the history of a single town or neighborhood of a city. If you spend 1 minute referencing an academic journal before attempting a skill check to Recall Knowledge about the subject, you gain a +1 item bonus to the check. The GM determines what scholarly journals are available in any location.

title: Scholarly Journal (Compendium)
contents: property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | L | Price | 30 gp

text | Scholarly journals are uncommon. Each scholarly journal is a folio on a very specific topic, such as vampires or the history of a single town or neighborhood of a city. If you spend 1 minute referencing an academic journal before attempting a skill check to Recall Knowledge about the subject, you gain a +1 item bonus to the check. The GM determines what scholarly journals are available in any location.

text | A compendium of journals costs five times as much as a single journal and requires both hands to use; each compendium contains several journals and grants its bonus on a broader topic, such as all undead or a whole city.

title: Scroll (1st-Level Spell)
contents: text | A scroll contains a single spell that you can cast without having to expend a spell slot. A scroll can be Crafted to contain nearly any spell, so the types of scrolls available are limited only by the number of spells in the game. The exceptions are cantrips, focus spells, and rituals, none of which can be put on scrolls. The spell on a scroll can be cast only once, and the scroll is destroyed as part of the casting. The spell on the scroll is cast at a particular spell level, as determined by the scroll. For instance, a scroll of magic missile (1st level) can be used to cast the 1st-level version of magic missile, but not a magic missile heightened to 2nd level. If no level is listed, the scroll can be used to cast the spell at its lowest level.

text | If you find a scroll, you can try to figure out what spell it contains. If the spell is a common spell from your spell list or a spell you know, you can spend a single Recall Knowledge action and automatically succeed at identifying the scroll's spell. If it's not, you must use Identify Magic to learn what spell the scroll holds.
text | See the following for more details on the rules for Scrolls.

title: Scything Blade Snare
contents: text | This snare sends a powerful series of scything blades to slice through a creature entering the snare's square, dealing 14d8 slashing damage (DC 31 basic Reflex).

title: Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser)
contents: text | This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
text | The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 10 minutes.

title: Sea Touch Elixir (Moderate)
contents: text | This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
text | The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 1 hour, and you can breathe underwater.

title: Sea Touch Elixir (Greater)
contents: text | This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
text | The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for 24 hours, and you can breathe underwater.

title: Serene Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves to +2 when you attempt Will saves against mental effects. The duration is 1 minute.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

title: Serene Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves to +3 when you attempt Will saves against mental effects. The duration is 10 minutes.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

title: Serene Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves to +4 when you attempt Will saves against mental effects. When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

title: Serene Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks.  When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead, and your critical failures on Will saves against mental effects become failures instead. The duration is 1 hour.
text | **Drawback** You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

title: Serum of Sex Shift
contents: text | Upon drinking this potion, your biology instantly transforms to take on a set of sexual characteristics of your choice, changing your appearance and physiology accordingly. You have mild control over the details of this change, but you retain a strong "family resemblance" to your former appearance.

text | The magic functions instantaneously and can't be counteracted. Your new anatomy is as healthy and functional as your previous body's, potentially allowing you to procreate (depending on your ancestry's biology). Drinking a subsequent serum of sex shift allows you to either revert back to your original form or adopt other sexual characteristics, as you choose. The elixir has no effect if you are pregnant or from an ancestry with no sexual differentiation. Most ancestries have a wide spectrum of sexual differentiation, some common, others more rare.

title: Shadow Rune
contents: text | Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

title: Shadow (Greater) Rune
contents: text | Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

title: Shadow (Major) Rune
contents: text | Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

title: Shadow Essence
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | injury | negative | poison
text | Distilled from the Plane of Shadow, this oily substance imposes tenebrous effects. The enfeebled condition from shadow essence lasts for 24 hours.
section | Affliction DC 29 Fortitude; **Onset** immediate; **Max Dur.** 6 rounds
bullet | Stage 1 | 3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison damage (1 round)
bullet | Stage 2 | 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
bullet | Stage 3 | 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

title: Shark Tooth Charm
contents: text | This dried seaweed bracelet is lined with charms shaped like small shark teeth. When you activate the bracelet, if you roll a success on the triggering check, you get a critical success instead (if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead). If you fail the Acrobatics check against a grabbing creature, the creature must either release you as a free action or take 2d8 piercing damage as shark's teeth momentarily emerge from your skin.

title: Shifting Rune
contents: text | With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form.

text | The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon's runes and any precious material it's made of apply to the weapon's new shape. Any property runes that can't apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.

title: Shining Ammunition
contents: text | A piece of shining ammunition gives off a faint glow. When shot, this ammunition sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes. If it hits a target, it sticks, causing the target to shed light in the same radius. A creature can remove the ammunition with an Interact action, but the ammunition itself continues to glow for the rest of the duration or until destroyed.

title: Shock Rune
contents: text | Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

title: Shock (Greater) Rune
contents: text | Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.
text | Electricity damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's electricity resistance (and the other creatures' on a critical hit).

title: Shrinking Potion (Standard)
contents: text | This fungus-flavored potion conveys the effects of the shrink spell to make you and all your gear smaller. After the onset, you remain small for 10 minutes.

title: Signal Whistle
contents: text | When sounded, a signal whistle can be heard clearly up to half a mile away across open terrain.

title: Signaling Snare
contents: text | A subtle snare used in hunting or tracking, a signaling snare often consists of carefully prepared earth, piled sand or stones, specific arrangements of vegetation, and so forth.

text | When a creature enters a square of a signaling snare, nothing happens to the creature, but instead it causes a small, unobtrusive disruption to the terrain that allows the snare's creator or another creature who knows what to look for to determine whether a creature of the appropriate size entered the square.

title: Silver (Chunk)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

title: Silver (Ingot)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

title: Silver (Low-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

title: Silver (Standard-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

title: Silver (High-Grade  Object)
contents: text | Silver weapons are a bane to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.

title: Silver Armor (Low-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 140 gp

text | Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

title: Silver Armor (Standard-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 1200 gp

text | Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

title: Silver Armor (High-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by armor | Price | 20000 gp

text | Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes sickened 1. A creature with weakness to silver is sickened 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

title: Low-Grade Silver Buckler
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

title: Silver Shield (Low-Grade)
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

title: Standard-Grade Silver Buckler
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

title: Silver Shield (Standard-Grade)
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

title: High-Grade Silver Buckler
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

title: Silver Shield (High-Grade)
contents: text | Silver shields don't typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

title: Silver Weapon (Low-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 40 gp
text | Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

title: Silver Weapon (Standard-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 880 gp
text | Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

title: Silver Weapon (High-Grade)
contents: property | Bulk | varies by weapon | Price | 9000 gp
text | Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

title: Silversheen
contents: text | You can slather this silvery paste onto one melee weapon, one thrown weapon, or 10 pieces of ammunition. Silversheen spoils quickly, so once you open a vial, you must use it all at once, rather than saving it. For the next hour, the weapon or ammunition counts as silver instead of its normal precious material (such as cold iron) for any physical damage it deals.

title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Lesser)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +1 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 1 minute.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Moderate)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +2 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 10 minutes.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Greater)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +3 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 1 hour.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

title: Silvertongue Mutagen (Major)
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | elixir | mutagen | polymorph
text | Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.

text | **Benefit** You gain a +4 item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead. The duration is 1 hour.

text | **Drawback** You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

title: Skeleton Key (Standard)
contents: text | A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves' tools when attempting to Pick a Lock, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.
text | If the skeleton key becomes broken due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves' tools and loses its benefits until repaired.
section | **Activate** [[free-action]] Interact; **Trigger** You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven't rolled yet
text | The key casts knock on the lock you're trying to pick.

title: Skeleton Key (Greater)
contents: text | A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves' tools when attempting to Pick a Lock, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.
text | If the skeleton key becomes broken due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves' tools and loses its benefits until repaired.
section | **Activate** [[free-action]] Interact; **Trigger** You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven't rolled yet
text | The key casts knock on the lock you're trying to pick.
text | The key grants a +2 item bonus, and you can activate the key once per hour.

title: Sky Hammer
contents: text | The sturdy, steel head of this +3 major striking flaming shock orichalcum warhammer is shaped like a blazing comet.
section | **Activate** [[reaction]] command; **Trigger** Your attack roll with the sky hammer is a critical success
text | A 6th-level arcane fireball spell explodes, centered on the sky hammer. The spell DC is 45. You are immune to the fireball's effect, though your allies are not.

title: Sleep Arrow
contents: pftrait | consumable | enchantment | magical | mental | sleep

text | Sleep arrows often have shafts of deep blue or black, and their fletching is exceptionally soft and downy. An activated sleep arrow deals no damage, but a living creature hit by it is subject to the effects of a sleep spell (DC 17).

title: Slick Rune
contents: text | This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

title: Slick (Greater) Rune
contents: text | This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

title: Slick (Major) Rune
contents: text | This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

title: Sling Bullets
contents: text | These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

title: Slippers of Spider Climbing
contents: text | These soft slippers are made of fine gray silk. If the slippers are left unattended for a while, they tend to attract spiders that nest inside.

text | Tiny, hairlike tendrils extend from the slippers' soles, allowing you to walk on vertical surfaces or even to move upside down along ceilings. For 1 minute, you gain a 20-foot climb Speed and you don't need to use your hands to Climb. However, the slippers require decent traction for you to walk on a wall, so they provide no benefit when you're moving across greased, icy, or oiled surfaces.

title: Slumber Wine
contents: pftrait | alchemical | consumable | ingested | poison | sleep
text | Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury.

text | Characters unconscious from slumber wine can't wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don't need to eat or drink while unconscious in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a DC 40 Medicine check.
section | Affliction DC 32 Fortitude; **Onset** 1 hour; **Max Dur.** 7 days

title: Smokestick (Lesser)
contents: text | With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a 5-foot burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

title: Smokestick (Greater)
contents: text | With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a 20-foot burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

title: Snake Oil
contents: text | You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn't feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a DC 17 Perception check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil's effects.

title: Snare Kit
contents: text | This kit contains tools and materials for creating snares. A snare kit allows you to Craft snares using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn snare kit as part of the action to use it.

title: Snare Kit (Specialist)
contents: text | This kit contains tools and materials for creating snares. A snare kit allows you to Craft snares using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn snare kit as part of the action to use it.
text | A specialist snare kit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check.

title: Sneaky Key
contents: text | This small silver skeleton key can be pinned to armor or a sleeve. When you turn the key to activate it, for the next minute, if the outcome of any your attempts to Pick a Lock is a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

title: Speed Rune
contents: text | Attacks with a speed weapon are supernaturally swift. While wielding a speed weapon, you gain the quickened condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the etched weapon.

title: Spell-storing Rune
contents: text | A spell-storing rune creates a reservoir of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower into the weapon. The spell must have a casting of 2 actions or fewer and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect—it is instead stored for later. When you wield a spell-storing weapon, you immediately know the name and level of the stored spell. A spell-storing weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM's choice stored in it.
text | You unleash the stored spell, which uses the target of the triggering attack as the target of the spell. This empties the spell from the weapon and allows a spell to be cast into it again.
text | If the spell requires a spell attack roll, the result of your attack roll with the weapon determines the degree of success of the spell, and if the spell requires a saving throw, the DC is 30.
text | Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.

title: Spellbook (Blank)
contents: property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 gp

text | A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

title: Spellguard Shield
contents: text | This shield bears eldritch glyphs to guard against magic. While you have this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) raised, you gain its circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells that target you (as well as to AC).

title: Spellstrike Ammunition (Type I)
contents: text | Mystic patterns create a magic reservoir within this ammunition. You activate spellstrike ammunition by Casting a Spell into the ammunition. The spell must be of a spell level the ammunition can hold (1st-level or lower), and the spell must be able to target a creature other than the caster. A creature hit by activated spellstrike ammunition is targeted by the spell. If the creature isn't a valid target for the spell, the spell is lost.

text | The ammunition affects only the target hit, even if the spell would normally affect more than one target. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, use the result of your ranged attack roll with the ammunition to determine the degree of success of the spell. If the spell requires a saving throw, the target attempts the save against your spell DC.
